title: I hope Instagram’s self-harm ban won’t stop us being open about depression
text:
Ian Russell is one of those brave and campaigning parents who waives anonymity in the wake of unthinkable tragedy in order to help others. In 2017, his 14-year-old daughter, Molly, took her own life after a period of depression.

Molly had just won the lead role in the school play, was making plans for a holiday internship, and had drawn up a wish list of presents for her birthday later that month. She had packed her school bag, watched television with her family and gone to bed in an apparently normal mood.

However, in the last few hours of her life – and for some months before – the teenager had been viewing graphic content concerning self-harm and suicide on sites such as Instagram and Pinterest....
description: Ian Russell is one of those brave and campaigning parents who waives anonymity in the wake of unthinkable tragedy in order to help others.
